Class LyricsView

java.lang.Object
musicApp.views.View
musicApp.views.songs.LyricsView
public class LyricsView extends View
The LyricsView class is responsible for displaying and updating the lyrics of a song. It handles the user interactions and delegates actions to the LyricsController.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    static interface 
    LyricsView.KaraokeListener
     
    static interface 
    LyricsView.LyricsViewListener
    Listener interface for handling events in the LyricsView.

      public void init()
      Initializes the view. Sets up listeners and UI components.
      Specified by:
      init in class View

    • setKaraokeListener

      public void setKaraokeListener(LyricsView.KaraokeListener listener)

    • initButtons

      public void initButtons()
      Initializes the buttons by adding a listener to the currently loaded song property. When the song changes, the lyrics are updated.

    • showLyrics

      public void showLyrics()

    • showKaraoke

      public void showKaraoke()

    • handleLoadedSongChange

      private void handleLoadedSongChange()

    • refreshTranslation

      protected void refreshTranslation()
      Initializes translations for UI elements using the LanguageService. This method loads translated text for labels, buttons, and dialogs.
      Overrides:
      refreshTranslation in class View

    • initButtonsTypes

      private void initButtonsTypes(LanguageService lang)

    • getEditedLyrics

      public Optional<String> getEditedLyrics(String initialText)
      Displays a dialog to edit the lyrics.

    • updateLyrics

      public void updateLyrics()
      Updates the lyrics displayed in the view. Clears the current lyrics container and loads either a placeholder or the actual lyrics along with an edit header.

    • updateTimeLine

      public void updateTimeLine()

    • displayEmptyLyricsPlaceholder

      private void displayEmptyLyricsPlaceholder()
      Displays a placeholder when no lyrics are available. The placeholder includes a message and a button to add lyrics.

    • displayLyricsWithHeader

      private void displayLyricsWithHeader(List<String> lyrics)
      Displays the lyrics along with an edit header.

    • createEditButton

      private javafx.scene.control.Button createEditButton(String text)
      Creates a button with an edit icon and optional text.

    • clearKaraokeContainer

      private void clearKaraokeContainer()
      Clears the karaoke lyrics container and removes all nodes except the placeholder and header.

    • setPlaceholderVisible

      private void setPlaceholderVisible(boolean visible)
      Sets the visibility of the karaoke placeholder. If visible, it shows a message indicating that no karaoke lyrics are available.

    • createKaraokeLabel

      private javafx.scene.control.Label createKaraokeLabel(KaraokeLine line, boolean highlight)
      Creates a label for a karaoke line with optional highlighting. The label is styled with CSS classes for karaoke and selected lyrics.

    • renderKaraokeLines

      private void renderKaraokeLines(List<KaraokeLine> lines, KaraokeLine activeLine)
      Renders the karaoke lines in the karaoke lyrics container. It clears the container, sets the placeholder visibility, and adds labels for each line. If a line is active, it scrolls to that line.

    • updateKaraokeLyrics

      public void updateKaraokeLyrics()
      Updates the karaoke lyrics displayed in the view. It retrieves the karaoke lines from the karaoke controller and renders them.

    • updateKaraokeLyricsHighlight

      public void updateKaraokeLyricsHighlight(List<KaraokeLine> lines, KaraokeLine activeLine)
      Updates the karaoke lyrics highlight based on the active line. It retrieves the karaoke lines from the karaoke controller and renders them with highlighting.

    • getLrcFile

      public Optional<Path> getLrcFile()
      Shows a file chooser dialog to select an .lrc file.

    • showOverwriteTxtConfirmation

      public Optional<Boolean> showOverwriteTxtConfirmation()
      Shows a confirmation dialog asking if the existing .txt lyrics should be overwritten with the text from the LRC file. This method displays an Alert of type CONFIRMATION using pre-defined button types for "Yes", "No", and "Cancel".

    • refreshUI

      public void refreshUI()
      Refreshes the UI by reloading the translations.
